originalText.text:
Not organized.  My mammo appointment was scheduled for the March the city shut down.  When I was finally able to get a mammo I tried to get a new referral with a current date but they refused and had me make ANOTHER appointment for a new referral.

UPDATE: I was informed they now have their own mammography unit and did not have to go to Lenox Hill Radiology.  At my appointment the mammography tech was out and no one bothered to call and reschedule our (my mom and I) afternoon appointment. We wasted a trip there. I had to schedule another car service trip for my disabled wheelchair mother because we weren't notified THAT morning for an afternoon appointment.  They had more than enough time to call patients and let them know the technician was out.

Memorial Sloan Kettering did the reading which was negative but with density.  Due to past issues and density I ALWAYS have an ultrasound with or after my mammogram. Whoever read my results never suggested or referred an ultra sound.  I had to ask my gynecologist to write a referral for my ultra sound.
I will not be returning.

Advice to women with density: If they don't refer you for an ultra sound, strongly request an ultra sound with your mammo...if they refuse, go elsewhere.  Your health comes first!

originalText.text: Outstanding care. From the time I reached the exterior door to the time I left, I was greeted with patience, kindness, and respect. The waiting room was clean and comfortable, but I wasn’t in it long. The staff was ready before my appointment time. At each step of the journey, I was listened to and informed. Each person seemed genuinely concerned about my well-being and doing a great job.

text.text: Outstanding care. From the time I reached the exterior door to the time I left, I was greeted with patience, kindness, and respect. The waiting room was clean and comfortable, but I wasn’t in it long. The staff was ready before my appointment time. At each step of the journey, I was listened to and informed. Each person seemed genuinely concerned about my well-being and doing a great job.

originalText.text: I initially reached out to the center to schedule a mammogram because I had concerns even though I’m not 40 yrs old. I spoke with a woman who was quite rude and she informed me that I would not be able to receive a mammogram because I’m not of age, despite the fact that women under 40 girls and men get breast cancer. Her supervisor did call to follow up w/ me. He was empathetic and assured me that the person would be addressed accordingly. I didn’t let this experience stop me from advocating for my health, and was able to receive a mammogram at Lenox Hill Radiology. I did not receive any pushback nor mistreatment or negativity, and there were women of all ages at the center. So, if you are looking for a good facility  I recommend checking out Lenox Hill Radiology.

originalText.text: I never knew it existed because I was always going to the 66th Street location.  I recently went here for my annual mammogram and I must say I was very pleased with the service that I got from everyone there. I will be going here from now on!

text.text: I never knew it existed because I was always going to the 66th Street location.  I recently went here for my annual mammogram and I must say I was very pleased with the service that I got from everyone there. I will be going here from now on!

originalText.text: I  am writing this review on behalf of my mom who had the worst experience with this location this morning. She had an 8am appt arrived on time and instead of being handled like a patient should she was dismissed because "I haven't had my coffee and doughnuts yet". She then sat and waited while people with appts after her were called to the back. Since she had another appt after she went to the front desk informing that she had another appt and was promptly dismissed afain. I realize that we are in the midst of a pandemic but I do not need to have my senior citizen mom go to have a mamogram done only to leave with elevated blood pressure and feeling extremely upset. I will make it my business to find a corporate email address to ensure that her voice and concerns are heard and hopefully to prevent someone else's mom from being treated in this manner by unprofessional inept front desk staff.
